title: L∞ Error and Bandwidth Selection for Kernel Density Estimates of Large Data.
abstract: Kernel density estimates are a robust way to reconstruct a continuous distribution from a discrete point set. Typically their effectiveness is measured either in  L  1  or  L  2  error. In this paper we investigate the challenges in using  L  ∞  (or worst case) error, a stronger measure than  L  1  or  L  2 . We present efficient solutions to two linked challenges: how to evaluate the  L  ∞  error between two kernel density estimates and how to choose the bandwidth parameter for a kernel density estimate built on a subsample of a large data set.
